alert.note: Alert for Northern Berkshire; Southern Berkshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 25 at 3:34AM EST until February 25 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches. Some sleet could mix in this morning mainly across Greene, Columbia and southern Berkshire counties. * WHERE...The Mohawk Valley, Capital District, northern and central Taconics, Schoharie Valley, Helderbergs, northern Catskills, northern portions of the mid Hudson Valley and the Berkshires. * WHEN...Until 10 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult and treacherous. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute and may impact the evening commute along and north of the Capital Region. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Maximum snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hours are expected, mainly this the morning. Snow may mix with or briefly change to sleet in the morning before changing back to snow in the afternoon.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
